thing-type.label: GE 12730 (ZW4002) In-Wall Smart Fan Control
thing-type.description: In-Wall Smart Fan Control<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<h1&gtProduct Features</h1&gt <ul&gt<li&gtIncludes white and light almond paddles that will match most standard wall plates (wall plate not included).</li&gt <li&gtCan be controlled in groups of multiple devices.</li&gt <li&gtEasily locate the switch in a dark room with the integrated blue LED indicator.</li&gt <li&gtUse by itself or with up to four GE add-on switches in three, four, five and six-way wiring configurations.</li&gt </ul&gt<h1&gtProduct Specifications</h1&gt <ul&gt<li&gtBrand: GE/Jasco</li&gt <li&gtModel Number: 12730</li&gt <li&gtZ-Wave Cert Number: ZC08-14110015</li&gt </ul&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtFollow the instructions for your Z-wave certified controller to include a device to the Z-wave network.</li&gt <li&gtOnce the controller is ready to include your device, press and release the top or bottom of the smart fan control switch (rocker) to include it in the network. Note: Your controller may need to be within 10 feet of the device to be included.</li&gt <li&gtOnce your controller has confirmed that the device has been included, refresh the Z-wave network to optimize performance.</li&gt </ol&gt<p&gtPlease reference the controller/gatewayâ€™s manual for instructions. Now you have complete control to turn your fixture ON/OFF and adjust fan speed levels according to groups, scenes, schedules and interactive automation programmed by your controller. If your Z-wave certified controller features Remote Access, you can now control your fixture from your mobile devices.</p&gt <p&gtNote: To exclude and reset the device, follow the instructions provided by your Z-Wave controller</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtFollow the instructions for your Z-wave certified controller to exclude a device to the Z-wave network.</li&gt <li&gtOnce the controller is ready to exclude your device, press and release the top or bottom of the smart fan control switch (rocker) to exclude it in the network. Note: Your controller may need to be within 10 feet of the device to be exclude.</li&gt <li&gtOnce your controller has confirmed that the device has been excluded, refresh the Z-wave network to optimize performance.</li&gt </ol&gt

parameter.name: config_7_1
parameter.label: 7: Z-Wave Command Dim Step
parameter.description: Z-Wave Command Dim Step<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtIndicates how many levels the dimmer will change for each dimming step.</p&gt <p&gtBoth the number of steps (or levels) that the dimmer will change and the timing of the steps can be modified to suit personal preferences. The timing of the steps can be adjusted in 10 millisecond intervals. As an example, the default setting for parameter 8 is 3. This means that the lighting level will change every 30 milliseconds when the Dim Command is received. A value of 255 would mean that the level would change every 2.55 seconds. Combined, the two parameters allow dim rate adjustments from 10 milliseconds to 4.2 minutes to go from maximum-to-minimum or minimum-to-maximum brightness levels.</p&gt</p&gt
